class Solution:
    def minimumOperations(self, nums: List[int], target: List[int]) -> int:
        arr = []
        for i in range(len(nums)):
            arr.append(target[i]-nums[i])
        
        # print(arr)
        i = 0
        ans = 0
        n = len(arr)
        while i<n:
            a = arr[i]
            if a>0:
                mn = arr[i]
                #########################
                m = 0
                if(i>0 and arr[i-1]>0):
                    m = arr[i-1]
                #########################
                # increasing 
                while i+1<n and arr[i+1]>=arr[i]:
                    i+=1
                mx = arr[i]
                # decreasing 
                while i+1<n and arr[i+1]<=arr[i] and arr[i+1]>0:
                    i+=1
                
                mn = min(mn,arr[i])
                
                ans += mx-m
                # print("+ve",i)
            elif a<0:
                mx = arr[i]
                #########################
                m = 0
                if(i>0 and arr[i-1]<0):
                    m = arr[i-1]
                #########################
                # decreasing
                while i+1<n and arr[i+1]<=arr[i]:
                    i+=1
                mn = arr[i]
                # increasing
                while i+1<n and arr[i+1]>=arr[i] and arr[i+1]<0:
                    i+=1
                mx = max(mx,arr[i])
                ans += -(mn-m)
                # print("-ve",i)
                
            i+=1
                
        return ans
